data.title: Great food
data.text: The food here was amazing honestly some of the best greek food I have ever eaten, and the atmosphere was superb a woman was playing the piano while we ate and it was one of the best dining experiences I've had. However I did feel that the portions were not reflective of the price, but still amazing overall

data.title: Good Greek food, friendly owner and staff
data.text:
I, my wife and son visited on our way through Lawton.  We had just seen a segment about the restaurant on Discover Oklahoma (the TV show) a few days earlier.
We were not disappointed. The hummus and pita appetizer was generous and fresh, and the flaming feta cheese appetizer was a risk we took that paid off -- delicious!!

Our entrees were the supreme gyros platter, very tasty overall, although too much diced cucumber for my taste.
Their baklava is unique and flavorful.

We're glad we stopped by!

data.title: Good food!
data.text: Good food. Sweet wait staff. Clean and cozy. The food wasn't the best Greek food in my life, but it wasn't the worst. Just plain good.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: We come here for dinner once or twice a month.  Best gyros in lawton hands down and great prices! Gyro sandwich,  gyro platter and fries with extra cucumber sauce is what we order all the time. Staff is always friendly and helpful!

data.title: Greek food.
data.text: If you are staying in Lawton, craving Greek food, this is a must. Authentic sit down. The owners (true Greek). Staff is friendly and food was amazing. They even had a party of 30 and were able to feed us quality(not bad for a small 20-30 table restaurant).

data.title: Great food!
data.text: I eat at Lars a couple of times a month. Good food. Great service. My usual is the gyro platter. Try the hummus! It is the very best I've ever eaten. Silky smooth!

data.title: Clised
data.text: Drove out of the way on a Sunday. It was closed. The menu looked great but we ended up at the white buffalo at the mall definitely common and mediocre. Burger joint.

data.title: Excellent food and quick, friendly service
data.text: My husband and I went for lunch right when they opened at 11am on a Saturday. We were greeted as we walked in and told to take any seat while they finished getting tables ready. Our server was quick and attentive. We ordered the hummus plate as an appetizer. Pita was hot and fresh and hummus was excellent. I ordered the Supreme Gyro Plate. Lamb was the best I have ever had. My husband got the greek salad with lamb and really enjoyed his also. They gave us some homemade green hot sauce that the chef was testing. It was perfect with the lamb. We will be back for sure!!

data.title: Lunch somewhere different
data.text: We eat lunch at Lar's Greek house a couple times per month.  Wait staff is friendly, prices are reasonable and the food is great.

data.title: Excellence
data.text: What a unexpected surprise. Simply put the best Greek food since Greektown in Chicago. The atmosphere is so warm and comfortable. Service was excellent. We had some eggplant dip, gyros and a flafel sandwiches. Next time we will try the entrees. They take about 20 MIN and we were in a time crunch. The prises are solo reasonable. A must do

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: When I visit Lawton we have to eat here at least once during our trip. Great food and friendly staff. Our favorite place to eat.

data.title: Great greek
data.text:
Nice small Greek spot in the downtown district. Had a little women playing piano while we were there. Service was good. I had the kalamata which was insane. We started with the veggie platter which was very nice. 
Only complaint is no alcohol and the fire alarm battery needs to be change as it beeped for 2 hours straight. Don't miss this place.

data.title: perfect
data.text: great service and great food..it is pricey for Lawton...however , not pricey compared to other restaurants that serve food of this quality.

data.title: Great food and service
data.text: I was given a bowl of soup and a menu upon sitting down. I ordered the supreme gyro platter. Extremely Fast and courteous service. My food is excellent, the meat is very tender and the ingredients are fresh. I love the cucumber sauce too. Worth the visit and recommended.

data.title: Excellent Service and great food!
data.text: My family and I were attending my son's graduation at Ft Sill and were pleasantly surprised by this "hole in the wall" restaurant.  I had  classic gyro and loved it, but the best was Cornish hen with a spicy sauce.  You won't be disappointed!

data.title: One of my favorites!
data.text:
I love this restaurant! I love that they bring in a piano player from time to time. But I really, really love their food. My favorite is the stuffed grape leaves, so yummy! 
Today is my birthday and I'm trying to figure out how to get my Hubby to bring this home for me for my birthday lunch. That's how much I love it. :)

data.title: Amazing greek food!
data.text:
OK, I started with some of the best hummus I have ever had, that came with some of the best pita bread ever. And on that my meal was... OK, I have no idea what it was... some kinda of ceramic bowl that was about 500 degrees, and spitting and spurting what looked like lava! I was scared to even try it, and really had NO idea where to ever start! Well after giving it a little time to cool down and not spit all over me I just dove in with my fork... WOW! I still have no idea what this thing was... some kind of soup stew, lamb, goodness!!! It was amazing! I ate the whole thing and cleaned the bowl with the that amazing pita! Everything we had here was just amazing. 
The atmosphere was mediocre, and the service was not the best... but the food... OH MY GOODNESS the food! It was amazing!

data.title: Great!
data.text:
I highly recommend Lars. Wonderful food, family atmosphere, live music. 
Plenty to eat and the service was the best part. Very warm welcoming place.

data.title: Wonderful food and friendly owner
data.text: The food is amazing. Nice change of pace to all the chain restaurants Lawton has. The wait staff can be hit or miss but the food makes up for it everytime.

data.title: Don't miss the greek food in Lawton (Formerly Adam's Greek House)
data.text: While in town for my son-in-law's graduation from Army boot camp, we went to Lar's Greek House.  It's in a fairly non-descript neighborhood in Lawton.  Despite it's outward appearance, the food was excellent.  We had the appetizer plate that included a nice selection of hummus, baba ghanoush, falafel, and a greek salad.  Everything was fresh and tasty.  I had the gyro sandwhich and it was very good and much more than I could eat.  The meat was tender and juicy with a soft pita bread.  This is definitely a place to stop.
